superior to Left 4 Dead, Dead Island and all the other dime-a-dozen zombie shooters in my opinion. The weapons all feel satisfying, the combat is visceral and intense, and quite a few times i've nearly pissed myself when attacked in the dark. If you have friends who play this game, who you can actually stand playing with, grab it now! And have a good one ;)

A survival shooter similar to L4D2 but less goal oriented. Your only goal is to survive each wave of baddies until you come across the big boss baddy. The more you kill, the more money you earn, which can be traded in for ammunition and stronger weapons. Lastly, dying doesn't slow you down too much as you respawn at the end of each wave, but with your starter equipment.

Is it fun? YES! It still requires some thinking and teamwork to get through each wave on Normal difficulty and higher. If you like survival shooters, I think you'll enjoy Killing Floor.

Note: I and a friend have troubles hosting a game. Some system set up may be required to have your own server running.

Killing Floor, god's gift to man. 6 player survival horror co-op with a learning curve that'd make console players cry... if they weren't already crying from the 3-4 years of FREE CONTENT that larger companies would charge you $15 for annually. If you do not own this game, I highly recommend checking it out, or checking out.
A very fun game to play with friends, definitely a game to encourage your friends to buy.

One of the most cooperative and strategic FPS I've played these last 2 years.
Despite not having much background story, this game features extreme survival situations that can only be achieved if you work as a team, where everyone meets their chosen role. If you don't work as a team, failure is guaranteed.
Also, this game stands out for its support and maintenance through free updates by Tripware Interactive's team with adding new weapons, maps, achievements, special events, etc. Obviously, this game is geared towards the multiplayer experience, despite having a singleplayer mode.
Many people compare this game with the L4D franchise. This is a nonsense comparison because both are completely different games.
If you are looking for cooperation, survival strategies, a lot of weapons and gore without a lineal plot, Killing Floor is your game.
I thought this was a zombie killing simulation. It's actually about getting LODSOFMONEY. I suggest you just shutchomouf and wop your wad on the counter for this game.

Ora che è uscito il secondo, consiglio l'acquisto di quello dato che è nettamente superiore, almeno secondo me. Questo non significa che, se per un motivo o per un altro non potete permettervi il secondo, questo sia sconsigliato. Anzi, rimane uno dei miei giochi preferiti, basti vedere quante ore ci ho speso e continuerò a spenderci per platinarlo. Un gioco che non stanca davvero mai, anche grazie alle varie mod e alle nuove mappe che la comunità sforna ogni settimana!

Killing floor est un must have !

Ce jeu possède vraiment une très bonne ambiance, il est très addictif du fait qu'il faut beaucoup de temps pour monter les perks (classes) et le jeu devient de plus en plus intéressant, le niveau de difficulté est assez élévée (l'élément clé pour réussir c'est la coopération), les perks apportent un petit plus au gameplay (medic, support, commando...) il vaut mieux avoir une team polyvalente. Il y a pas mal de maps officielles et de plus en plus de serveurs avec des mods: 30 joueurs, perks personnalisées, nouveau zeds (ennemis)

Bref c'est des heures et heures de fun, et ce jeu est vraiment très accès sur la coopération, éviter de faire le solitaire ça ne marche pas !

L'un des meilleurs jeu de survie au quel j'ai jouer, de loin le plus dur et le plus fun.

yeah.

A long, slow, perpetual grind is required to get into the actual meat of this game, where roles are rigidly-defined and largely inflexible.  Seriously, hundreds of hours in total can be spent just getting to max level, which is the only way in which one can play at the higher difficulties for this game.  The reward for which is turning normal difficulties into a dull, unchallenging run, and access the higher difficulties which really just punish you harder for not playing exactly.

The gameplay often involves knowing every map rather well, where spawn points are, who stands in which spot, and who is allowed to shoot what.  The further along you get, the more your role is rigidly defined by the price-tags and the bonuses offered by your class, which you are usually stuck with after the first half of the game.

Honestly, I can't reccomend this game to anyone at full price.  Try it on a free weekend, judge it by your first few round
One of the best zombie killing games to date. A must have to all of those who take pleasure in fast paced undead killings (with the occasional slow-mo).

Mod Unreal enginu, založený na zabíjení vln mutantů jako zástupce jednoho povolání s určitými výhodami a slevami na zbraně daných kategorií. Nic extra, ale semtam na uvolnění je to určitě příjemná hra.

This game is a Mod of Unreal engine, based on killing (huh) oncoming waves of mutants. You can play as one of eight classes, I think, which give you specific bonuses and discounts on class weapons. Nothing special, but a good game for letting off steam now and then... steam, not Steam... :)
Damn good game for mindless violence and stress relief.

Killing Floor is a fun game since the perk levels give bonuses, like extra damage or cheaper weapon costs, and also challenging because you have to buy ammo, and fight tough enemies that can screw you over at lower levels.If you like co-op survival games, I recommend that you get Killing Floor.
An amazing zombie game. Mods are free, unlike Black Ops, and the gameplay is fresh and fun. Great to play with friends. A must buy, especially because it is so cheap.
